items.name: Component_ColorAnimation
items.content:
# ===================================================================
#
#   Script: Component_ColorAnimation
#
#   $$COPYRIGHT$$
#
# ===================================================================
class Component_ColorAnimation extends gs.Component_Animation
    ###*
    * Executes a color-animation on a game-object.
    *
    * @module gs
    * @class Component_MoveAnimation
    * @extends gs.Component_Animation
    * @memberof gs
    * @constructor
    ###
    constructor: (data) ->
        super
        
        ###*
        * The easing-object used for the animation.
        * @property easing
        * @type gs.Easing
        ###
        @easing = new gs.Easing(null, data?.easing)
        
        ###*
        * The start-color.
        * @property sourceColor
        * @type gs.Color
        * @protected
        ###
        @sourceColor = data?.sourceColor || new Color()
        
        ###*
        * The end-color.
        * @property targetColor
        * @type gs.Color
        * @protected
        ###
        @targetColor = data?.targetColor || new Color()
     
    ###*
    * Serializes the color-animation into a data-bundle.
    *
    * @method toDataBundle
    ###    
    toDataBundle: ->
        easing: @easing,
        sourceColor: @sourceColor,
        targetColor: @targetColor
     
     
 
    ###*
    * Updates the color-animation
    *
    * @method update
    ###    
    update: ->
        super
        
        if not @easing.isRunning then return
        
        @easing.updateValue()
        a = @easing.value
    
        @object.color.red = Math.floor((@sourceColor.red * a + @targetColor.red * (255 - a)) / 255)
        @object.color.green = Math.floor((@sourceColor.green * a + @targetColor.green * (255 - a)) / 255)
        @object.color.blue = Math.floor((@sourceColor.blue * a + @targetColor.blue * (255 - a)) / 255)
        @object.color.alpha = Math.floor((@sourceColor.alpha * a + @targetColor.alpha * (255 - a)) / 255)

        if not @easing.isRunning
            @object.color = @targetColor
            @callback?(@object, this)
    
    ###*
    * Starts the color-animation.
    *
    * @method colorTo
    * @param {Color} color The target color.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    * @param {function} [callback] An optional callback-function called when the animation is finished.
    ###          
    start: (color, duration, easingType, callback) ->
        @callback = callback
        @easing.type = easingType
        
        if @object.color.red == color.red and @object.color.green == color.green and
            @object.color.blue == color.blue and @object.color.alpha == color.alpha
           @callback?(@object, this)
    
        if duration == 0 or @isInstantSkip()
            @object.color = color
            @callback?(@object, this)
        else
            @sourceColor = new Color(@object.color)
            @targetColor = color
            @easing.startValue(255, -255, duration)
        
gs.Component_ColorAnimation = Component_ColorAnimation
